item.title: Team Falcons and The MongolZ Eliminated from Budapest Major Playoffs
item.content:encoded:
Team Falcons and The MongolZ are the first teams to fall from the StarLadder Budapest Major playoffs after both being swept by more capable opponents. Their fixtures ended with a 0-2 scoreline, with Spirit knocking out Falcons and a dominant Vitality squad dispatching The MongolZ.

The fan-favorite sides had sparked hopes of an underdog run through the Budapest playoffs, but it simply wasn’t to be. These two spirited campaigns come to an end, and we move on to day two of the playoffs.

If you want to place a wager on what’s left of the playoffs, Insider Gaming, together with the international betting brand GG.BET, brings you to the heart of unforgettable moments of the StarLadder Major Budapest 2025. Visit gg.bet to dive deeper, place your bets, and feel the adrenaline of esports!

First Eliminations Confirmed

The grand final round of the StarLadder Budapest Major is fast approaching, and one team is lining up to walk away with a massive $500,000 prize. Before that arrives, another five fixtures, including the BO5 grand final, has to take place.

Team Falcons fell short after facing the daunting challenge of Team Spirit, who entered the playoffs in formidable form. Spirit was dominant out of the gate, sweeping the series 2-0 without too much fuss.

It was a similar story for The MongolZ, and despite dishing out earlier upsets against some capable sides, Vitality was just too quickly able to outmaneuver the Mongolian side. It was unsustainable, and another 2-0 sweep brought another chapter of the Major to a close.

The remaining matches are set to be blockbuster fixtures:

  • Team Spirit vs. Team Vitality
  • MOUZ vs. FaZe Clan
  • Natus Vincere vs. FURIA

It’s anyone’s game right now.

Let us know on the Insider Gaming Discord server who you think will win this tournament.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news that Battlefield REDEC’s tournament was postponed

item.title: Tomb Raider Catalyst Leaks Ahead of The Game Awards For a 2027 Release
item.content:encoded:
A leak for a game called Tomb Raider Catalyst has leaked online ahead of The Game Awards, where an announcement is expected.

The leak came courtesy of a Reddit post on the Tomb Raider subreddit, where images of both a remake, titled ‘Tomb Raider Legacy of Atlantis,’ and a new mainline game called ‘Tomb Raider Catalyst’ were posted from what appears to be Amazon Games listings. You can see both images below:

2 New Tomb Raider Games

The first Tomb Raider game, Legacy of Atlantis, will be a remake of the 1996 game coming to PC, PlayStation 5, and Xbox Series S|X. The description of the game reads,

“Experience a stunning reimagining of Lara Croft’s 1996 genre-defining game with jaw-dropping visuals, modern gameplay, and new surprises that honor the spirit of the original.”

The second game, titled Tomb Raider Catalyst, will be coming sometime in 202,7 and it is described,

“Set in the wake of a mythical cataclysm that unleashed ancient secrets and awakened mysterious guardian forces, Tomb Raider: Catalyst follows Lara Croft on a new adventure across Northern India.

First announced in 2022, Tomb Raider has hardly seen the light of day since, with developer Crystal Dynamics going through a turbulent time with approximately 60 people being laid off this year alone.

What do you think of us getting two new Tomb Raider games by the end of 2027? Let everyone know what you think of this statement through the official Insider Gaming Discord Server.

If you have some spare time, keep up-to-date with all The Game Awards 2025 and everything announced, and if you’re a GTA fan, check out GTA Online receiving a brand-new feature after 12 years.

item.title: Rockstar Says Fired Employees Were Leaking Game Features
item.content:encoded:
The Rockstar Games firing controversy has been one of the biggest gaming stories of 2025. New developments have slowly trickled out about the firing of 34 Rockstar employees, but now the company itself has officially addressed the real reason that led to the action.

On November 24, Insider Gaming reported on leaked Discord messages revealing why Rockstar fired 34 employees. Now, Rockstar Games has officially given its side of the story, and the reasons are very interesting.

Rockstar Games Claims Employees Discussed Features From Unannounced Games

Rockstar Games has given IGN a statement, voicing its own take on the employee firings scandal, which led to protests:

“Rockstar Games took action against a small group of individuals, across the UK and internationally, who distributed and discussed confidential information (including specific game features from upcoming and unannounced titles) in a public forum, in breach of company policy and their legal obligations. Claims that these dismissals were linked to union membership or activities are entirely false and misleading.”

The only official title in development (that everyone knows about) at Rockstar Games right now is Grand Theft Auto 6. This will inevitably raise speculation about other games being worked on behind the scenes. A GTA 4 remaster has been discussed for the longest time, and you’d have to think Red Dead Redemption 3 is inevitable.

This statement comes less than 24 hours after UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer declared that Rockstar will be investigated due to a breach of union rights.

The Rockstar Games firing controversy looks to be far from over. Rockstar was hit with a legal claim shortly after the firings, and UK government action will only push the controversy further under the microscope. As always, Insider Gaming will continue to report on new evidence and developments in the ongoing case.

Let everyone know what you think of this statement through the official Insider Gaming Discord Server.

If you have some spare time, keep up-to-date with all The Game Awards 2025 and everything announced, and if you’re a GTA fan, check out GTA Online receiving a brand-new feature after 12 years.

item.title: The Game Awards 2025—Everything Announced
item.content:encoded:
On Thursday, December 10, the 12th annual The Game Awards took place from Los Angeles. And while the primary focus of the show is the awards that are given during the night, many fans tune in to see the game announcements that are featured throughout. And with everything happening on one night, it can be hard to keep track, that’s why Insider Gaming has a list of everything announced during The Game Awards 2025.

The 12th annual award show starts at 8pm ET/5pm PT, but there’s also a 30-minute pre-show beginning at 7:30pm ET/4:30pm PT. You can watch the show on Twitch, YouTube, Amazon Prime, TikTok, Twitter, Facebook, and Instagram.

If you are looking for all of the winners at this year’s awards, Insider Gaming has a full rundown of every award winner for you.

Check out all of the game reveals and announcements for yourself below. And be sure to leave your reactions down in the comments and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

Everything Announced At The Game Awards 2025

As games are shown and trailers become available, they will be updated below in the order they appeared. If something is missing, please make it known in the comments.

The Free Shepherd

Decrepit

Audio Mech

For more Insider Gaming, check out everything that was announced at Day of the Devs for December 2025.

item.title: The Game Awards 2025—All Award Winners
item.content:encoded:
The Game Awards 2025 took place on Thursday, December 10 in Los Angeles, and it was a night to celebrate everything gaming has brought fans this year. While Insider Gaming has full coverage of everything announced at the show, awards will also be given away. Here’s the full list featuring every winner at The Game Awards 2025.

The Game Awards 2025 starts at 8pm ET/5pm PT, but there’s also a 30-minute pre-show beginning at 7:30pm ET/4:30pm PT. You can watch the show on Twitch, YouTube, Amazon Prime, TikTok, Twitter, Facebook, and Instagram.

Check out all of the nominees and winners below. As the awards are announced, the winner will be highlighted in bold to stand out. In addition, the order of the awards will be updated to show the order they were revealed.

Be sure to bookmark this page and come back often for the latest results as the show airs. You can also let us know your thoughts down in the comments and join the discussion in the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

The Game Awards 2025 Award Winners

Best Family Game

  • Mario Kart World
  • Donkey Kong Bananza (WINNER)
  • LEGO Voyagers
  • Sonic Racing: CrossWorlds
  • LEGO Party
  • Split Fiction

Best in Accessibility

  • Assassin’s Creed Shadows
  • Atomfall
  • Doom: The Dark Ages (WINNER)
  • EA FC26
  • South of Midnight

Game of the Year

  • Clair Obscur: Expedition 33
  • Hollow Knight: Silksong
  • Donkey Kong Bananza
  • Death Stranding 2: On The Beach
  • Kingdom Come Deliverance 2
  • Hades 2

Best Game Direction

  • Supergiant Games – Hades 2
  • Hazelight Studios – Split Fiction
  • Kojima Productions and PlayStation – Death Stranding 2: On The Beach
  • Sandfall Interactive – Clair Obscur: Expedition 33
  • Sucker Punch Productions – Ghost of Yotei

Best Ongoing Game

  • No Mans Sky 
  • Fortnite 
  • Marvel Rivals
  • Final Fantasy XIV 
  • Helldivers 2 

Best Community Support

  • Baldur’s Gate 3
  • Final Fantasy XIV
  • No Man’s Sky
  • Helldivers 2
  • Fortnite

Best Narrative

  • Death Stranding 2: On The Beach
  • Clair Obscur: Expedition 33
  • Ghost of Yotei
  • Silent Hill f
  • Kingdom Come Deliverance 2

Best Art Direction

  • Ghost of Yotei
  • Clair Obscur: Expedition 33
  • Death Stranding 2: On The Beach
  • Hades 2
  • Hollow Knight: Silksong

Best Score/Music

  • Hades 2
  • Clair Obscur: Expedition 33
  • Ghost of Yotei
  • Hollow Knight Silksong
  • Death Stranding 2: On The Beach

Best Audio Design

  • Silent Hill f
  • Ghost of Yotei
  • Battlefield 6
  • Clair Obscur: Expedition 33
  • Death Stranding 2: On The Beach

Best Performance

  • Erika Ishii as Atsu – Ghost of Yotei
  • Charlie Cox as Gustave – Clair Obscur: Expedition 33
  • Jennifer English as Maelle – Clair Obscur: Expedition 33
  • Troy Baker as Indiana Jones – Indiana Jones and the Great Circle
  • Kotatsu Kato as Hinako – Silent Hill f
  • Ben Starr as Verso – Clair Obscur: Expedition 33

Games for Impact

  • Wanderstop
  • Lost Records: Bloom & Rage
  • Despelote
  • Consume Me
  • South of Midnight

Best Independent Game

  • Clair Obscur: Expedition 33
  • Absolum
  • Blue Prince
  • Ball x Pit
  • Hollow Knight: Silksong
  • Hades 2

Best Debut Indie Game

  • Clair Obscur: Expedition 33
  • Blue Prince
  • Despelote
  • Dispatch

Best Mobile Game

  • Wuthering Waves
  • Persona 5 The Phantom X
  • Destiny: Rising
  • Sonic Rumble
  • Umamusume: Pretty Derby

Best VR/AR Game

  • The Midnight Walk
  • Marvel Deadpool VR
  • Alien: Rogue Invasion
  • Arken Age
  • Ghost Town

Best Action Game

  • Ninja Gaiden 4
  • Hades 2
  • Shinobi: Art of Vengeance
  • Battlefield 6
  • Doom: The Dark Ages

Best Action/Adventure Game

  • Ghost of Yotei
  • Hollow Knight: Silksong
  • Split Fiction
  • Indiana Jones and the Great Circle
  • Death Stranding 2: On The Beach

Best Role-Playing Game

  • Monster Hunter Wilds
  • Kingdom Come Deliverance 2
  • Avowed
  • The Outer Worlds 2

Best Fighting Game

  • Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves

  • 2XKO
  • Mortal Kombat: Legacy Kollection

Best Simulation/Strategy Game

Best Adaptation

Arcade1Up Reportedly ‘Closing Operations’ Very Soon

Arcade1Up is one of the biggest and most popular gaming cabinet distributors in the world, and it’s closing its doors soon.

TheBurntPeanut Finally Gets an Escape from Tarkov Streamer Item

TheBurntPeanut now has an Escape from Tarkov streamer item, after using the platform to grow immeasurably in recent months.

Lords of the Fallen Surprise Final Update Revealed

Lords of the Fallen is getting another ‘final update’, as revealed by CI Games out of the blue earlier today.

Deus Ex Remastered Has Been Delayed

Only a few months after its announcement trailer for a Sony State of Play, Deus Ex Remastered has been delayed.
